utils

Class KeyboardReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • java.io.BufferedReader
        • utils.KeyboardReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable

    public class KeyboardReader
extends java.io.BufferedReader
    Adapted from the original KeyboardReader written by Nicolaas tenBroek for CSCI 130.

    This wrapper class for a BufferedReader removes the burden of blank input and NumberFormatExceptions which allows the programmer to focus on getting keyboard input from the user rather than handling user caused exceptions.

    Original copyright Heartland Community College (c) 2003

    Copyright Jackson Wilson (c) 2017

      • isDataAvailable

        public boolean isDataAvailable()
        Returns true if data is waiting in the buffer, or false if the stream is not ready or there is no input waiting in the buffer.
        Returns:
        A boolean that determines if the reader is ready.

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed.
        Overrides:
        readLine in class java.io.BufferedReader
        Returns:
        A String containing the contents of the line, not including any line- termination characters, or null if the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine(java.lang.String prompt)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Prompts user and reads a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed.
        Parameters:
        prompt - A message to prompt the user for input.
        Returns:
        A String containing the contents of the line, not including any line- termination characters, or null if the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
